hi anyone familiar with dyndns.com clien: you can try the ez-ipupdate program, it works for dyndns here.
ty , when in doubt and on a hurry I take first suggestions
is it on cron or what
no. it is a daemon itself.
maybe I updatedb and locate it on /etc ? the ez-ipupdate daemon I mean?

autostart? it will start when your computer starts, and listen to the interface you specify. when the IP changes on that interface, the ez-ipupdate daemon will notify dyndns of the new IP. To reconfigure it, use sudo dpkg-reconfigure ez-ipupdate, to restart the daemon use sudo invoke-rc.d ez-ipupdate restart.
you do not need to think about the daemon itself.
how do I check it is alive now?
well, there are many ways to check. But first, did you run sudo dpkg-reconfigure ez-ipupdate, and enter your information?
if it prompted you already, that is cool.
to see whether the process is running, ps aux|grep ez. To test whether the whole thing is working now, change your IP address, maybe by shutting down, then bringing up your interface.
